text:
[**Age over 90 323**] y/o F on HD for ESRD M/W/F ([**2-11**] HIT), BLE thrombus [**2-11**] HIT, s/p bil
   AKA, PVD, CAD, CABG, MI; ESRD, h/o anemia, renal osteodystrophy, GERD,
   hypothyroidism, EF 45-50%, afib w/ RVR, cardioverted in past. Pt being
   treated with levaquin and albuterol nebs since Tuesday for pna; pt has
   been in contact with her two daughters, who were both recently ill
   requiring abx; prior to bringing pt in to hospital [**7-27**], son noted that
   pt was tachycardic to 120
s, hypoxic, and lethargic, she is more
   confused, and coughed up large amt sputum.  Patient admitted to micu
   with dx of Pna. Hypotensive on levophed. Intubated [**7-28**] and started on
   cvvhd. CVVHD stopped am of [**2143-7-30**] for ? of citrate toxicity as ionized
   ca low and serum ca nl to high.
   Events: 4u ffp transfused without signs or symptoms of reaction for cl
   placement and ogt placement.  Team unable to place left ij. Site with
   ecchymosis but without hematoma.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name **])
   Assessment:
   [**Name (NI) 1373**] pt on settings: 40% TV LS rhonchorous upper and diminished @
   bases with suctioning for small to mod amt of thick, yellow secretions.
   AM CXR appears to be improving per ICU team.
   Action:
   Pt tol psup for <2 hrs, became tachypnic and would not settle on own.
   Response:
   Immediately comfortable when placed back on A/C mode.  Some periods of
   tachypnea w/ stimulation. Comfort w/ vent when relaxed/sleeping.
   Plan:
   Will continue to wean vent as tolerated.  AM CXR.
   Sepsis without organ dysfunction
   Assessment:
   Received on Levophed gtt 0.04mcg/kg/min and @ goal MAP > 55.
   Action:
   Required additional levophed, titrated up and now attempting to titrate
   down.  Bld cx x2 sent (from a-line and TLC), Straight cath for 30cc
   and sent urine for cx, sent sputum as well.  New L ant PICC placed @
   bedside.
   Response:
   Goal MAP >55, pt w/ +3 dependent edema, weaping from a few skin tears
   on arms, no change in abx.  Vanco trough from AM labs was 23 (no dose
   given today)
   Plan:
   Wean levophed as tolerated with goal map >55. Continue ABX.  f/u cx
   results.  Remove TLC and cx tip.  Monitor vanco trough w/ AM labs.
   Renal failure, End stage (End stage renal disease, ESRD)
   Assessment:
   BUN/Creat stable.  Anuric.  Remains grossly fluid overloaded with >19L
   positive length of stay.
   Action:
   Straight cath for 30cc
s (ordered twice per week), restarted CVVHDF
   using 1L NS w/ 20mg Argatroban for filter priming.
   Response:
   Labs sent for CVVHDF @ 1800, attempting to remove 50cc/hr w/ cvvhdf
   Plan:
   Monitor CVVHDF labs, titrate KCL and Ca gtt
s per protocol, adjust
   argatroban gtt per protocol.
